name: Inflow
headline: A self-help app for people to manage their ADHD.
description: Inflow is a self-help app for people to manage their ADHD. They provide support through psychoeducation, habit development, and community.

founders.name: Levi Epstein, Founder
founders.description:
✔️ Co-Founder @ Inflow 
🚀On a mission to help every person with ADHD reach their full potential.
⏮️Ex-Babylon Health Product Manager
📚London School of Economics, Imperial
📍London, UK

generated_description:
**Inflow Summary**

Inflow is revolutionizing the way individuals manage ADHD with its science-backed self-help app. Founded in 2020 and a participant in Y Combinator's Batch S21, Inflow has quickly positioned itself as a leader in the mental health technology sector. Headquartered in London, UK, the company boasts a dedicated team of 20 employees focused on delivering valuable psychoeducation, habit development tools, and a supportive community for users.

The core mission at Inflow is simple yet profound: to empower individuals diagnosed with ADHD to take control of their lives. This is achieved through a carefully crafted platform that helps users understand their neurodivergent brains, develop lifelong skills, and enhance productivity. 

The app is primarily designed by clinicians and psychologists specializing in ADHD, ensuring that it is not just another mental health app but a scientifically grounded tool that genuinely addresses the needs of its users. With features like a quiz to assess ADHD tendencies and robust resources for education and support, Inflow is engaging users holistically.

They're also making waves in the media, having been featured in notable publications like TechCrunch and on platforms such as Product Hunt. This recognition reinforces Inflow’s credibility in a market that is increasingly recognizing the importance of mental health and accessible resources.

If you're looking to understand more about managing ADHD or looking for community support, Inflow presents itself as a compelling option. To get started, you can visit their website [here](https://getinflow.io/). 

In essence, Inflow is more than just an app; it's a movement towards better mental health management for those living with ADHD.
